application_strategy: Apply to 5-7 scholarships to increase chances. Even small scholarships (€300/month) add up significantly over 2 years!

scholarships.name: DAAD Study Scholarships - Master Studies
scholarships.coverage: Monthly stipend, health insurance, travel allowance, study materials (€460/year)
scholarships.eligibility: Bachelor's degree, excellent academic record, motivation letter, 2-3 recommendation letters
scholarships.note: Most prestigious, apply for Winter 2027 intake (deadline Oct 31, 2026)

scholarships.name: Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.coverage: Monthly stipend, health insurance, study materials, networking events, seminars
scholarships.eligibility: Commitment to green politics/sustainability, social engagement, academic excellence, max 30 years old

scholarships.name: Friedrich Ebert Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.coverage: Monthly allowance, health insurance, ideological training, networking
scholarships.eligibility: Social democratic values, commitment to social justice, developing country background preferred, GPA 3.0+

scholarships.name: Hanns Seidel Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.coverage: Monthly stipend, health insurance, study allowance, seminars
scholarships.eligibility: Christian values, social engagement, academic merit, connection to Bavaria preferred

scholarships.name: Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung (KAS) Scholarship
scholarships.coverage: Monthly stipend, health insurance, study allowance, travel costs, German language course, ideological seminars
scholarships.eligibility: Outstanding academic record, social/political engagement, proficiency in German or willingness to learn, max 30 years for Masters, alignment with Christian democratic values

scholarships.name: Rosa Luxemburg Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.coverage: Monthly allowance, health insurance, study materials, ideological training seminars, networking
scholarships.eligibility: Commitment to social justice and left-wing politics, academic excellence, involvement in political/social activities

scholarships.name: Deutschlandstipendium (Germany Scholarship)
scholarships.eligibility: High academic achievement, social engagement, personal circumstances considered, available at MOST German universities
scholarships.note: Apply directly through your university after admission. Applications typically twice yearly

scholarships.name: KAAD Scholarships for Developing Countries
scholarships.coverage: Monthly stipend, travel allowance, health insurance, study allowance, language course
scholarships.eligibility: Catholics from developing countries (Africa, Asia, Latin America, Middle East), academic excellence, social commitment, return-to-home-country commitment

scholarships.name: Erasmus Mundus CYBERSURE
scholarships.coverage: Full tuition waiver, monthly living allowance, travel costs, installation costs, insurance
scholarships.eligibility: Bachelor in Computer Science/Engineering, excellent academic record (GPA 3.5+), English proficiency (IELTS 6.5+)
scholarships.countries: Norway, Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Estonia, France, Austria (Schengen)
scholarships.priority: VERY HIGH - Premium scholarship + Joint degree from 7 universities!
scholarships.note: Study at NTNU, Aalto, KTH, DTU, Tartu, EURECOM, TU Graz

scholarships.name: Erasmus Mundus EDISS (Data-intensive Software)
scholarships.coverage: Full tuition, monthly living allowance, travel costs, installation costs
scholarships.eligibility: Bachelor in CS/Engineering, strong academic record, English proficiency
scholarships.priority: HIGH - Software systems, data engineering focus

scholarships.name: Erasmus Mundus DEAI (Data Engineering and AI)
scholarships.coverage: Full tuition fees, monthly living allowance, travel and installation costs, insurance
scholarships.eligibility: Bachelor's degree in CS/Engineering/Mathematics, strong programming skills, English proficiency (IELTS 6.5+)

scholarships.name: Erasmus Mundus RADMEP (Radiation Effects)
scholarships.coverage: Full tuition waiver, monthly stipend, travel allowance, insurance
scholarships.eligibility: Bachelor in Physics/Engineering/Electronics, excellent academic performance, English proficiency (B2 minimum)

scholarships.name: Bayer Foundation Scholarships
scholarships.coverage: Annual financial support for outstanding students
scholarships.eligibility: Excellent academic performance in biology, medicine, chemistry, or related engineering fields, studying at German universities

scholarships.name: TUM Scholarships
scholarships.coverage: Monthly stipend, varies by scholarship type
scholarships.eligibility: Admitted TUM students, academic excellence, specific to each scholarship program
scholarships.priority: MEDIUM - Only if admitted to TUM

scholarships.name: RWTH Aachen Scholarships
scholarships.eligibility: RWTH students, academic merit, social engagement
scholarships.priority: MEDIUM - Only if admitted to RWTH

scholarships.name: NRW (North Rhine-Westphalia) Scholarships
scholarships.coverage: Monthly stipend for students in NRW state universities
scholarships.eligibility: Students at universities in North Rhine-Westphalia state (RWTH, Uni Bonn, Ruhr Uni Bochum, etc.)

strategy_tips.tip_1: Apply to at least 5-7 scholarships to maximize chances
strategy_tips.tip_2: Start with Erasmus Mundus (highest value, full coverage)
strategy_tips.tip_3: German foundation scholarships (Heinrich Böll, Friedrich Ebert, etc.) are less competitive than DAAD
strategy_tips.tip_4: Deutschlandstipendium is available at EVERY German university - apply after admission
strategy_tips.tip_5: Even small scholarships add up: €300/month = €7,200 over 2 years!
strategy_tips.tip_6: Tailor each application - show alignment with foundation's values
strategy_tips.tip_7: Strong motivation letter > perfect GPA. Show passion and clear goals!
strategy_tips.reality_check: With €500/month scholarship, total 2-year cost in Germany = only €10,000-€15,000!
